Name: Pesto Genovese
Author: Notafine
Description: Make simple, delicious pesto in the time it takes your pasta to cook.

instructions.List_item: Drop the pasta into salted, boiling water and cook until al dente.

In the food processor, combine the nuts, garlic and red pepper; pulse until smooth. Add the basil and 1/4 cup of grated cheese and blend again. Begin adding olive oil until a smooth pesto forms that's not overly oily. (If it gets too oily, add more cheese.)
When the pasta has 1 minute left to cook, add the green beans and potatoes to the pasta water and cook for 1 minute. Fill a coffee mug halfway with pasta water; set aside.

Drain the pasta and veggies in a colander, then return them to the pot. Add a little olive oil, and stir to incorporate. Add the pesto and stir, making sure all the noodles are coated. Pour in some pasta water from the mug, if needed, to create a creamy texture.

Note: No note, please leave note section blank

instructions.List_item: Preheat waffle iron. Beat eggs in large bowl with hand beater until fluffy. Beat in flour, milk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla, just until smooth.
Spray preheated waffle iron with non-stick cooking spray. Pour mix onto hot waffle iron. Cook until golden brown. Serve hot.

Name: Grilled Corn on the Cob
Author: SUETEITSMA
Description: This is an easy method for grilling corn on the cob. The corn will be very tasty and tender.

instructions.List_item: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.
Peel back corn husks and remove silk. Place 1 tablespoon butter, salt and pepper on each piece of corn. Close husks.
Wrap each ear of corn tightly in aluminum foil. Place on the prepared grill. Cook approximately 30 minutes, turning occasionally, until corn is tender.

Name: Custard-Style (French) Ice Cream
Author: Nota
Description: Make simple, delicious pesto in the time it takes your pasta to cook.

instructions.List_item: In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and half of the sugar. Set aside.

In a medium saucepan, stir together the cream, half-and-half, salt, and remaining sugar. Heat the mixture over medium-high heat, stirring often, until it comes to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium.
Add about 1/2 cup of the cream mixture to the egg mixture while whisking constantly (this helps prevent the eggs from cooking). Repeat with another 1/2 cup of the cream mixture.
Using a heatproof spatula, stir the cream mixture in the saucepan constantly as you pour the egg mixture into the pan.
Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and mixture coats the back of the spatula, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat.

Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl and whisk in the vanilla extract. Set the bowl in an ice bath and stir the base occasionally until it's cooled to room temperature. Remove the bowl from the ice bath, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate at least 2 to 4 hours or overnight before churning, either in an ice cream machine or by hand (see below for tips on how to churn ice cream).

Note: This requires a lot of tools that are not listed

Name: Famous Brownies
Author: Fredrick George III
Desciprtion: Our famous brownie dessert will send you to an entire other plain of existence, eat them.

instructions.List_item: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F
Grease and flour an 8 inch pan
Melt 1/2 cup butter in large saucepan
Remove butter from heat , stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla
Beat 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup flour, a pinch of salt, and baking powder
Spread in pan
Bake in oven for 25 to 30 minutes
FROSTING - Combine 3 tablespoons of butter (softened), 3 tablespoons of cocoa, honey, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1 cup confectioners' sugar
Stir until smooth, then frost brownies while they are still warm
Enjoy!

Note: You might gain weight because you will want to eat the whole pan of brownies.

Name: Chicken Scampi
Author: kevin.
Description: Easy to make, butter, succulent chicken pasta

ingredients.List_item: 1 teaspoon lemon zest and some lemon juice

instructions.List_item: Bring a pot of water to a rolling  boil and salt the water
Sprinkle salt onto chicken
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot, the add oil to pan
Brown the chicken in the pan til golden brown but not cooked all the way through (2-3 minutes)
Move chicken to a plate
melt 4 tablespoons of butter in skillet, add garlic, red pepper flakes, and cook until garlic is golden brown
Add wine to skillet and bring to simmer and cook until the wine reduces by half then remove from heat
Cook pasta until al dente and reserve 1 cup of pasta water
Add pasta water to skillet along with chicken, lemon zest and juice and remaining butter
Stir at medium-low heat until butter is melted in
Removed from heat, sprinkle grated cheeseand parsely on top
YUM

Name: Cream Cheese Stuffed French Toast
Author: Anonymous
Description: Super yummy french toast with an unconventional twist

instructions.List_item: Mix cream cheese and brown sugar in a small bowl until well incorporated
Spread 2 tablespoons of cream cheeese mixture on each  of 4 slices of bread, then press other 4 slices of bread on top to for 4 sandwiches
Whisk eggs in 13x9 inch baking dish. Stir in milk, cinnamon and vanilla until well blended
Dip sandwiches in egg mixture, making sure that each side soaks for about 2 minutes
Melt butter in large non-stick pan on medium-low heat. Place sandwiches in pan. Cook 4-5 minutes per side or until golden brown
Serve with syrup and fruit
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F
Lightly grease a 9-inch baking dish with butter and place dish in the oven to heat up
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornmeal, suagr, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together
Create well in the center of dry ingredients, add buttermilk ang eggs
Mix together until fully combined, then add in slightly cooled butter, mix again until everything is fully incorporated
Remove HOT dish from oven and pour batter into hot dish
Bake until the cornbread begins to brown on top (20-23 minutes)
Let cool for 10 minutes
Take doritos out of bag
Crush doritos
Pour doritos in mountain dew
shake
